captions.text: - Allison has the most deal breakers
of anyone I've ever met.
- Gaby has none, and that's a problem.
- The only time I was like Tinder's great.
- Tinder is hell on earth
where all your hopes go to die. (laughs)
- Talking about your ex too much.

30 seconds fine, but if
you keep talking about it,

it's like I'm your date,
I'm not your therapist.
- Guys who chew with their mouths open.

- That sounds horrible.
- It's so gross.

I had an ex boyfriend who I
would consistently be eating,
and I'd be like please close your mouth.
- If he texts during the date, nope.
- Rude.
- Brush your teeth at least twice a day.
If you don't do this, you are gross.

- No smoking.
- Ew.
- If I wanted to make out with a cigarette
or a chimney, I would just do that.
- That thing will kill you.

If I don't kill your
first, that'll kill you.
- Guys that spit.
They're like (makes spit sound).

I can't even do it 'cause
I would never do that.

- I've never gotten why
that's just like an OK thing

for people to do.
- Yeah.
- Deal breaker, Crocs.
Deal breaker, Ed Hardy.
Deal breaker, looks like he drives
a motorcycle, but doesn't.
- Guys who wear those pastel shorts.
Pastel shorts really don't do it for me.
- Who do they do it for?

- Interesting guys, you could
also describe as unstable.
- I like a tall rich guy.
Nothing original about it,

but it's been working
for everyone for years.
- Look, women love stability.
It's science.

We like guys who have
their (bleep) together.
It's sexy.
- Guys who have bad grammar.
Anyone who uses the wrong you're--

- Oh my God!
- the wrong to,
the wrong where's--
- The wrong where's?
Some people do that?
- Oh absolutely.
- What is wrong with everyone?
- If you're against nick names,
I don't wanna date you.
That's not fun.

- This is why Sex in the
City has misled me so much.
I thought that when I got older

guys would be like, "Hey
Pop Tart, how you doing?"
I'd be like, "Oh good, hi."
But no guys call you Pop Tart.
You need to call girls Pop Tart.
That's a cute ass nickname.
- If you're a super (bleep) talker.
I talk (bleep) every now and then,

but if you talk (bleep)
about everything, we're done.

- They sit down and are
immediately complaining
about their long day, you know,
or like if they talk too much.
'Cause I need to talk too much.
That's my thing.
- I don't like someone who needs me
as their entire social life,

who's constantly checking
in about what I'm up to.

- I'm confused because
I'm all those things.
- I once dated a guy and I was like
he has so much time for me.
And then I realized he had no friends.
- He needs to have a social life

because what happens when
you go out with your girls?

- You don't like it when
women are obsessed with you,

but you like it when men
are obsessed with you.
That's weird.
- Ladies are scary.
- Guys that get too handsy,
like they're just kinda all over you.
- So, you like grilled cheese?
(laughs)
Someone's a little too thirsty.
- Guys that don't get tested.
They're probably hiding something.
- Guys that are very hyper-masculine.
Yeah, so I got a nine inch dick.
What you gonna do about it?
Nothing.

- I think people can
come up with all kinds

of deal breakers, and then
when they meet someone,

their pheromones take over,
and it doesn't matter.

- I mean honestly, we
never follow the rules.
- There's a lot of silly deal breakers,

but I feel like there's
places to compromise
when you really like someone.
- Grammar's not silly. (laughs)

- If you have any big
significant disagreements

about how you want your lives
to play out, deal breaker.

- [Gaby] Unless you're
wiling to compromise.
- [Allison] Then you'll be miserable.
- (laughs) Like the rest of us.
(Allison laughs)

title: Girls Talk About Dating Deal Breakers

comments.author: Cryptonymicus

comments.text:
Why don't we call you poptart? Well, when every single aspect of your life 
is full of sexual harassment PSAs (especially when you grow up with it) - 
work, school, college, popular television shows and movies - some of us 
actually listen, and we try to treat you (specifically) in the manner in 
which we are told you (the gender) wish to be treated. It can't be both 
ways. Either you have to take the good random names to get your attention, 
along with the bad, or you have to do without them all together. Remember, 
what might be cute and fun to you, might not be fun for someone else.

TL;DR - Society is why we don't call you poptart...﻿

comments.text:
I don't know that I have any hard and fast deal breakers, other than being 
racist, homophobic, and super macho as though you've got something to 
prove. It's easier for me to think of things that I do like:
-Being humble
-Can converse at length about art, music, politics
-SENSE OF HUMOR

The girl who says "I love a tall, rich guy" is very pretty, but her 
standards make her sound shallow as hell. I've met a few girls like that, 
and I honestly think they give women a bad name. Having a husband with 
money doesn't guarantee happiness in and of itself unless you're a 
simple-minded person with the wrong fucking priorities.﻿

comments.author: Dominican Domination

comments.text:
It's so funny when I hear about height being a dealbreaker. Before I met my 
s/o I was adamant that if I dated a guy he would have to be taller than me. 
Of course when I fell for a guy who was shorter than me and found out my 
feelings were requited, the fact I was no more than an inch taller 
(barefoot) was the LAST thing that came to my mind.

 I can get it if you don't want to bend your knees to kiss someone, but 
don't let an inch or two in height be a deal breaker.﻿
